description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau told a public inquiry he found it “very improbable” the Chinese government would prefer his Liberal Party to win recent elections, given the high tensions between the two countries.
title: Trudeau Rejects Claim China Meddled to Try to Help His Election

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economy editor Molly Smith looks at the impact of today’s inflation numbers. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Fed, Biden Campaign Confounded as Inflation Digs In

description: The Biden administration has stepped into Enbridge Inc.’s fight over an oil pipeline in Wisconsin, arguing an earlier ruling did not consider the impact on US policy and did not adequately compensate indigenous landowners.
title: Biden Administration Wants Enbridge Pipeline Ruling Revisited

description: Peru will no longer require tourist visas for Mexican tourists, putting an end to a short-lived diplomatic move meant to reciprocate on similar restrictions imposed on Peruvian tourists traveling to Mexico.
title: Peru Backtracks Visa Requirement For Mexicans on Tourism Industry Pressure

description: The US Federal Trade Commission is asking Congress to change the law so it can handle its own privacy settlements and other consumer protection cases that it’s currently forced to refer to the Justice Department.
title: FTC Asks Congress for Authority to Try Its Own Consumer Cases

description: Jeff Yass, the Republican political donor who holds a 15% stake in TikTok parent ByteDance Ltd., gave $8 million in March to a Republican super political action committee.
title: Billionaire Jeff Yass Gives $8 Million to Republican Super PAC in March

description: California has devoted $24 billion to homelessness programs during the last five years. The problem’s only gotten worse.
title: California Spent $24 Billion on Homelessness and It Can’t Measure the Impact

description: President Joe Biden said he delivered a “blunt and straightforward” message to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on improving civilian conditions in Gaza.
title: Biden Says He’s Watching Netanyahu After Their ‘Blunt’ Talk

description: US President Joe Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida pledged to intensify efforts to harness wind power and speed the transition to clean-energy amid concerns in resource-scant Japan over access to liquefied natural gas.
title: Biden, Kishida Eye Wind Power as Japan Worries About LNG Supply

description: Ecuadorian President Daniel Noboa got away with a diplomatic slap on the wrist from the Organization of American States after raiding the Mexican embassy in the capital.
title: Noboa Gets Slap on Wrist for Ecuador’s Raid on Mexican Embassy

description: President Joe Biden reiterated his support for US workers opposed to a Japanese company’s bid to acquire United States Steel Corp., while stopping short of calling again for continued domestic ownership.
title: Biden Affirms Support for US Workers Against US Steel Sale

description: Veteran oil industry executive Ireneusz Fafara will take over as the head of Orlen SA amid growing political uncertainty over deals that transformed the refiner into a self-styled national energy champion.
title: Orlen Picks New CEO as Fate of Polish Energy Company Stays Hazy

description: The leftist Economic Freedom Fighters, South Africa’s third-largest party, expects no outright winner to emerge from next month’s elections, and is positioning itself as a king-maker to determine who next runs the country.
title: South Africa’s Leftist EFF Angles to Join Government After Vote

description: The US and its allies believe major missile or drone strikes by Iran or its proxies against military and government targets in Israel are imminent, in what would mark a significant widening of the six-month-old conflict, according to people familiar with the intelligence.
title: US Sees Missile Strike on Israel By Iran, Proxies as Imminent

description: Former President Donald Trump and House Speaker Mike Johnson are scheduled to hold an event on election integrity at Trump’s Mar-a-Lago estate on Friday, according to people familiar.
title: Trump, House Speaker Mike Johnson to Discuss Election Integrity on Friday

description: Elon Musk will meet President Javier Milei at Tesla Inc.’s factory in Austin, Texas, Friday morning during a week-long trip abroad, Argentina’s government announced Wednesday.
title: Musk to Meet Argentine President Milei at Tesla Factory Friday

description: President Javier Milei circulated a new, scaled-back version of his sweeping reform bill to Argentine lawmakers, in his clearest tilt toward political pragmatism since taking power.
title: Milei Seeks Second Chance From Congress With Scaled-Back Reform

description: A third consecutive month of higher-than-expected inflation data dealt a double-barreled blow to Joe Biden’s political prospects ahead of November’s election, exacerbating concerns voters could punish him over high prices and delaying hopes for Federal Reserve rate cuts the president has predicted.
title: Biden’s Battle Against Inflation Gets Tougher With Latest Data

description: Peter Magyar, Hungary’s newfound political star who’s seeking to take on nationalist Prime Minister Viktor Orban, applied to register a political party for European Parliament elections.
title: Orban Adversary Peter Magyar Moves to Register Party for EU Vote

description: An Israeli airstrike on Gaza killed three sons of Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh, the militant group said, among its most high-profile casualties since the start of the war six months ago.
title: Hamas Says Israeli Strike Killed Three Sons of Leader Haniyeh

description: The European Union cleared a major hurdle toward adoption of a key migration and asylum policy criticized by some human-rights activists and lawmakers for potentially aggravating existing problems.
title: EU Clears Way for New Immigration Rules Ahead of June Elections

description: South Africa’s fossil fuel subsidies rose to a 118 billion rand ($6.3 billion) in the 2023 fiscal year, providing incentives that encourage their continued use, according to a Canadian think tank.
title: South Africa Fossil Fuel Subsidies Top $6 Billion, Study Shows

description: The introduction of Zimbabwe’s new currency, known at the ZiG, is expected to bring an end to stock market volatility and help restore overall price stability, Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube said.
title: Zimbabwe’s Finance Chief Sees ZiG Currency Ending Market Volatility

description: Switzerland is imposing financial sanctions and travel restrictions against six individuals which are involved in financing Hamas and the organization Palestinian Islamic Jihad, the government said in a statement on Wednesday.
title: Switzerland Backs EU Sanctions Against Six Hamas Supporters

description: Five months after a single scathing social media post from Donald Trump scuttled Tom Emmer’s hopes of becoming House speaker, the former president praised him at a Mar-a-Lago fundraiser that earned the Minnesota congressman more than $300,000.
title: Trump Courted by Once-Scorned Speaker Hopeful Tom Emmer as Mike Johnson Teeters

description: Brazil will maintain tariffs on US ethanol imports despite “tough” complaints from the Biden administration, said Agriculture Minister Carlos Fávaro.
title: Brazil Rebuffs US Pressure to Abandon Tariffs on Ethanol Imports

description: More than a quarter of the UK’s international aid budget is spent domestically on asylum seekers and refugees, putting further pressure on the amount sent overseas for support, a government watchdog said.
title: UK Spends Quarter of Foreign Aid Budget Domestically on Refugees

description: Heba al-Helou, a Palestinian sheltering with her two daughters in a tent in Rafa, finally managed to access some desperately needed money this week after spending days jostling in queues at a currency exchange.
title: Gaza Faces Major Cash Shortage After War Destroys Banking System

description: Switzerland will host a high level conference on June 15-16 to consolidate global support for a peace formula advocated by Ukraine that would end the war with Russia.
title: Switzerland Announces Summit on Ukraine Peace Plan on June 15-16

description: Intensifying Ukrainian drone attacks are forcing Russian companies to find ways to protect their own plants and factories instead of relying on the military, providing an unexpected boost to radar and warfare-equipment producers.
title: Russian Factories Rush to Buy Drone Defense From Local Suppliers

description: The French government said its deficit will be wider than anticipated as pressure mounts on Emmanuel Macron to cut expenses — or find new sources of state income.
title: French Deficit Will Be Wider Than Previously Expected

description: UK Foreign Secretary David Cameron urged the US Congress to treat aid to Ukraine as “an investment in American security” that will help the war-torn nation repel Russian invaders and stymie Vladimir Putin’s ambitions.
title: UK’s Cameron Says US Aid to Ukraine Is Investment in Security

description: Get caught up on the day’s political news
title: Fake It Till You Make It: AI's Disinformation Risk For Elections

description: The Swiss government stopped short of offering the country’s banking watchdog the power to fine lenders, despite widespread support for the measure — including from the finance minister.
title: Swiss Stop Short of Giving Regulator Power to Fine Banks

description: A Japanese astronaut will be the first non-American to travel on a NASA lunar mission, the US and Japan plan to announce on Wednesday, according to a senior US official familiar with the delegations’ plans.
title: US, Japan to Announce Plans to Send Japanese Astronaut to Moon

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s cabinet approved measures to support companies involved in the reconstruction of Ukraine, with a focus on grants and favorable interest rates for Ukrainian firms as well as investment guarantees for their German counterparts.
title: Germany Takes Steps to Support Companies in Rebuilding Ukraine

description: European Union ministers will discuss next week what role the North Atlantic Treaty Organization can play in protecting the continent’s energy infrastructure from possible attack following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.
title: EU Weighs NATO Role to Shield Energy Links From Russian Attack

description: Ukrainian lawmakers are forging ahead with controversial legislation to recruit more troops as worries mount that a lack of manpower is hurting the country’s front-line forces.
title: Ukraine Moves on Mobilization Bill as Troop Numbers Raise Alarm

description: Czech lawmakers scrapped a proposal designed to help the government revamp dominant electricity utility CEZ AS, ending a yearlong tussle with investors that have weighed on the share price.
title: East EU’s Top Utility Gets Some Relief as Czechs Drop Split Plan

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Musk Picks a Fight He Can’t Win Against Brazil’s Supreme Court

description: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s conservative bloc is set for a major setback in a vote for a new parliament, exit polls showed, likely meaning he will be in a weak position for the remaining three years of his term and face political gridlock.
title: South Korea’s President Set For Big Loss in Parliament Vote

description: President Joe Biden and Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida have enlisted Amazon.com Inc. and Nvidia Corp. to fund a new joint artificial intelligence research program, as the two nations look to improve collaboration around the quickly emerging technology.
title: Biden and Kishida Enlist Amazon, Nvidia to Fund AI Research

description: Two-thirds of German companies operating in China say they face unfair competition in the market, a problem that threatens to push up their costs and erode profit margins.
title: German Firms in China See ‘Unfair’ Competition From Local Rivals

description: Elon Musk may have found in Brazil the strongest challenger yet to his free speech crusade: a Supreme Court that seems ready to take its fight against online disinformation as far as it deems necessary, no matter the criticism it faces.
title: Musk Meets His Match in Brazil’s Fake News-Fighting Top Court

description: The rand fell from the year’s best levels after a new opinion poll showed support for the ruling African National Congress is plunging and a party backed by former President Jacob Zuma may become the country’s third-biggest.
title: Rand Plunges as Poll Shows Zuma Eating Into ANC’s Support

description: Support for South Africa’s ruling African National Congress is plunging and a party backed by former President Jacob Zuma may become the country’s third-biggest after next month’s election, a new opinion poll shows.
title: ANC Support Plunges in South African Poll as Zuma Party Surges

description: Russian tycoon Mikhail Fridman and his business partner Petr Aven won surprise victories in their fight against European Union sanctions over their alleged links to President Vladimir Putin and the war he launched in Ukraine.
title: Tycoon Fridman Wins EU Sanctions Appeal Over Alleged Putin Ties

description: Rishi Sunak said the UK will not let foreign courts block his plan to deport migrants to Rwanda, and declared “enough is enough,” suggesting the prime minister is considering the UK’s ongoing membership of the European Convention on Human Rights.
title: Sunak Says He Won’t Let a ‘Foreign Court’ Block Deportations

description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping will meet former Taiwan President Ma Ying-jeou in Beijing for a landmark sitdown, the Taiwanese broadcaster TVBS reported, an event that appears aimed at showing the Communist Party’s lighter touch on the sensitive issue of the island’s status.
title: China’s Xi to Meet Ex-Taiwan Leader in Beijing, Report Says

description: Arms producer Czechoslovak Group AS reported record sales and profitability for last year as the war in Ukraine boosts demand for heavy ammunition and combat vehicles produced by the Prague-based company.
title: Czech Arms Producer CSG Reports Record €1.7b Sales for Last Year

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said he’s “horrified” to learn of an agreement between his predecessor, Rodrigo Duterte, and China that bars Manila from shipping construction materials to a military outpost in a disputed shoal in the South China Sea.
title: Marcos Says He’s ‘Horrified’ by Duterte Sea Deal With China

description: Thailand will fund a $14 billion cash handout program to stimulate the economy through a combination of state budget and assistance from a state bank, shelving an earlier plan to resort to a one-time borrowing.
title: Thailand to Fund $14 Billion Cash Handout Through Budget

description: NATO has “no time” to lose as Europe’s military industry ramps up production to keep pace with Russia’s war economy, Lithuania’s defense chief said.
title: ‘No Time’ to Lose Against Russia’s War Economy, Lithuania Says

description: President Joe Biden said he’s still considering unilateral action to shut the southern US border, and studying whether he has legal authority to do that without congressional approval.
title: Biden Says He May Have Authority to Close Border on His Own

description: Incoming Taiwan president Lai Ching-te chose as his premier a veteran official who has served in the current administration, underscoring his push for continuity.
title: Incoming Taiwan Leader Focuses on Continuity With Premier Pick

description: HONG KONG (AP) — A fire in a large, mostly residential building in Hong Kong on Wednesday morning killed at least five people and left another 27 injured.
title: Hong Kong Building Fire Kills at least 4 People, Injuring 12

description: Thai prosecutors delayed a decision on whether to indict former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra in a royal insult case over comments he made almost a decade ago.
title: Thai Prosecutors Delay Decision on Thaksin’s Royal Insult Case

description: President Joe Biden’s administration is looking to reverse China’s attempts to isolate countries in Asia including the Philippines with help from Japan and other allies in the region, according to US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel.
title: US Seeks to Isolate China With Help of Allies, Ambassador Says
